page.title: 03INNERLEITHEN CUSTOMS
page.content: {THE CLEIKUM CEREMONIES. Dressed in white habits with red sashes the{Dux boy}of St. Ronan's school represents the Saint and two boys from each class his brother monks A younger boy in green represents a lay brother and carries a lantern. At the installation ceremony the Saint receives his crozier or cleik with which{"Saint Ronan cleikit the de'il {and rid the place of evil."}From the War Memorial watched by hundreds of people the procession climbs to the mineral springs at St. Ronan's Wells. Then with the Masons in torchlight procession they proceed to the{Runic {Cross}where St. Ronan's hands are bathed with water from the Wells and a flock of white doves are released. Finally on Caerlee Hill as darkness falls St. Ronan lights the bonfire and the Devil disappears in the flames.
